title: Belfast Castle Walk Route

images.title: Ross, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Belfast Castle gardens and fountain. The castle was built to replace the original 12th century castle, destroyed by fire in 1708. Today's castle dates to 1870.

images.caption: Napoleon's Nose at Cave Hill. The hill's most famous feature, known locally as Napoleon's Nose, is believed to have been the inspiration for Jonathan Swift's novel, Gulliver's Travels.

images.title: Cave Hill path, Belfast - August 2014(2) by Albert Bridge, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Cave Hill path, Belfast

description: This historic castle in Belfast includes a lovely country park with miles of walking trails to try. This circular walk from the castle explores the immediate grounds before taking you through the castle woods to the excellent viewpoint at Cave Hill. On the way you can look out for lots of wildelife including long-eared owls and sparrowhawks. Start the walk at the castle car park where you can pick up trails taking you around the beautiful grounds where you can see the lovely gardens and the photogenic fountain. After exploring the grounds head north east to enter the peaceful woodland trails which will take you up to Cave Hill Cave. From the cave you head south to visit the Cave Hill summit where you can enjoy glorious views over the city to Belfast Lough, the coast, the Isle of Man, Scotland and the Mourne Mountains. After taking in the views you continue south to McArt's Fort before descending back through the woods to the castle. There's excellent facilities at the site with a visitor centre, antique shop, Millennium Herb Garden, restaurant, and a playground for children. There's also a fun cat hunting game where you can look out for a series of model cats around the garden area.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: After your exercise you could enjoy a well deserved afternoon tea back at the castle.

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: The woodland and parkland make for a fine dog walk. You will probably see other dog owners on your walk.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: Just to the north you can enjoy a climb to Carnmoney Hill where there are some peaceful woodland trails and more fine views over the area.

display_address: Belfast Castle Gardens, Downview Park West, Mount Vernon, Belfast, County Antrim, Northern Ireland / Tuaisceart Éireann, BT15 5GL, United Kingdom
